author: Black Kettle
text: Although the troops have struck us, we throw it all behind and are glad to meet you in peace and friendship.

text: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.

author: Doris Kearns Goodwin
text: Taft was Roosevelt's handpicked successor. I didn't know how deep the friendship was between the two men until I read their almost four hundred letters, stretching back the to early '30s. It made me realize the heartbreak when they ruptured was much more than a political division.

author: Len Wein
text: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.

author: Christie Brinkley
text: Share your smile with the world. It's a symbol of friendship and peace.

author: William Shenstone
text: The best time to frame an answer to the letters of a friend, is the moment you receive them. Then the warmth of friendship, and the intelligence received, most forcibly cooperate.

author: Plautus
text: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.

author: Suzanne Brockmann
text: The lust and attraction are often a given in a romance novel - I want to dig into the elements of true friendship that form a foundation for a solid, gonna-last-forever romantic relationship.

text: The two most misused words in the entire English vocabulary are love and friendship. A true friend would die for you, so when you start trying to count them on one hand, you don't need any fingers.

author: Sting
text: Success always necessitates a degree of ruthlessness. Given the choice of friendship or success, I'd probably choose success.

author: Vincent Nichols
text: Among young people, often a key factor in them committing suicide is the trauma of transient relationships. They throw themselves into a friendship or network of friendships, then it collapses and they're desolate.

author: Samuel Johnson
text: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, sir, should keep his friendship in a constant repair.

author: Herman Melville
text: Friendship at first sight, like love at first sight, is said to be the only truth.

author: Ethel Barrymore

text: Likings arise when one has no earthly reason for liking - the most wildly improbable marriages and uncommon friendship.

text: I'm loyal, and I like my friends. Friendship enriches your life and makes it more interesting.

text: The dupe of friendship, and the fool of love; have I not reason to hate and to despise myself? Indeed I do; and chiefly for not having hated and despised the world enough.

author: Frederick William Faber

author: Thomas Jefferson
text: Peace and friendship with all mankind is our wisest policy, and I wish we may be permitted to pursue it.

author: Epicurus
text: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.

text: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.

author: Li Peng
text: At the beginning of the new century, it is the common aspiration of the peoples of the two countries to deepen mutual understanding, enhance trust, develop friendship and strengthen cooperation.

author: Saint Basil
text: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.

author: Robert Blair
text: Friendship! Mysterious cement of the soul, Sweet'ner of life, and solder of society.

author: Armistead Maupin
text: The film itself involves a New York City radio storyteller, Gabriel Noone, who strikes up a friendship with one of his fans, an abused 14-year-old teenager who is suffering from AIDS, who does not have much longer to live.

author: Emily Bronte
text: Love is like the wild rose-briar; Friendship like the holly-tree. The holly is dark when the rose-briar blooms, but which will bloom most constantly?

author: Simone de Beauvoir
text: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.

author: E. W. Howe
text: Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better.

author: Charles B. Rangel
text: Since the Korean War, U.S. and South Korea have established an enduring friendship with shared interests, such as denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula, combating aggression abroad and developing our economies.

author: Thalia
text: Friendship is something that is cultivated.

author: Robert Southey
text: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.

author: Steven Van Zandt
text: Rock n' roll as a genre is different from pop and hip hop: it is about bands, and that for me suggests brotherhood, family, friendship and community.

author: Salman Rushdie
text: Friendships are the family we make - not the one we inherit. I've always been someone to whom friendship, elective affinities, is as important as family.

author: Giotto di Bondone
text: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.

author: Honore de Balzac
text: Nothing so fortifies a friendship as a belief on the part of one friend that he is superior to the other.

author: Henry David Thoreau
text: I had three chairs in my house; one for solitude, two for friendship, three for society.

author: John Wooden
text: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.

author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette
text: It is wise to apply the oil of refined politeness to the mechanism of friendship.

author: Eugene Kennedy
text: The real test of friendship is: can you literally do nothing with the other person? Can you enjoy those moments of life that are utterly simple?

author: Henry Ward Beecher
text: Laughter is not a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is the best ending for one.

author: Joanna Lumley
text: I don't think men are that attracted by glamour. I think women are attracted by glamour. I think men are attracted by a sense of friendship.

author: Paramahansa Yogananda
text: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.

author: Bidzina Ivanishvili
text: Restoration of friendship with Russia, our biggest neighbor, is necessary for our peace and economy.

author: W. Somerset Maugham
text: When you choose your friends, don't be short-changed by choosing personality over character.

author: Jane Green
text: I think friendship is more important than love, but that love that grows out of friendship is the very best of all.

author: Epicurus
text: It is not so much our friends' help that helps us, as the confidence of their help.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
text: Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship - never.

author: Ram Dass
text: We come into relationships often very much identified with our needs. I need this, I need security, I need refuge, I need friendship. And all of relationships are symbiotic in that sense. We come together because we fulfill each others' needs at some level or other.

author: Lord Byron
text: Friendship is Love without his wings!

author: Thiruvalluvar
text: To embrace the whole world in friendship is wisdom. This wisdom is not changeable like the flowers that bloom and fade.

author: Edward Gibbon
text: I understand by this passion the union of desire, friendship, and tenderness, which is inflamed by a single female, which prefers her to the rest of her sex, and which seeks her possession as the supreme or the sole happiness of our being.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
text: Without wearing any mask we are conscious of, we have a special face for each friend.

author: Stendhal
text: Friendship has its illusions no less than love.

author: Alanis Morissette
text: I'm quite obsessed with the idea of nailing the girl friendship. It's such an art, so delicate.

author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
text: If we are to judge of love by its consequences, it more nearly resembles hatred than friendship.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
text: A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.

author: Gina Bellman
text: Any friendship or relationship is about a language.

author: Jennifer Chiaverini
text: Mary Lincoln provided Elizabeth Keckley with opportunities for social and economic advancement she probably had never imagined during her years as a slave, while Elizabeth offered Mary the loyal, steadfast friendship she craved but had always found so elusive.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
text: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
text: Friendship is a disinterested commerce between equals; love, an abject intercourse between tyrants and slaves.

author: Mencius
text: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.

author: Marie de France
text: If one of two lovers is loyal, and the other jealous and false, how may their friendship last, for Love is slain!

author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
text: However rare true love may be, it is less so than true friendship.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.

author: Elbert Hubbard
text: Friendship, like credit, is highest when it is not used.

author: Recep Tayyip Erdogan
text: It is impossible to preserve my friendship with people who are allegedly leaders when they are attacking their own people, shooting at them, using tanks and other forms of heavy weaponry.

author: Mortimer Adler
text: Aristotle uses a mother's love for her child as the prime example of love or friendship.

author: Chester A. Arthur
text: As is natural with contiguous states having like institutions and like aims of advancement and development, the friendship of the United States and Mexico has been constantly maintained.

author: Bruce Lee
text: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.

author: Aristotle
text: Perfect friendship is the friendship of men who are good, and alike in excellence; for these wish well alike to each other qua good, and they are good in themselves.

author: Ann Landers
text: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.

author: Anne Lamott
text: Your experiences will be yours alone. But truth and best friendship will rarely if ever disappoint you.

author: Mariella Frostrup
text: Every friendship goes through ups and downs. Dysfunctional patterns set in; external situations cause internal friction; you grow apart and then bounce back together.

author: Pope Benedict XVI
text: Today, I, too, wish to reaffirm that I intend to continue on the path toward improved relations and friendship with the Jewish people, following the decisive lead given by John Paul II.

author: Aristotle
text: He who hath many friends hath none.

author: Anais Nin
text: What I cannot love, I overlook. Is that real friendship?

author: Stefanie Powers
text: I don't need to go onto Facebook and pretend to have friends I've never even met. To my mind, that kind of destroys the meaning of the word 'friend.' I take exception to that. Because I value and respect friendship.

author: Li Keqiang
text: China-Africa relationship has a long history and is full of vitality. Since the 1950s and 1960s, our common historical experiences have brought China and Africa together, and we have forged deep friendship in our joint struggle during which we have supported each other in times of difficulty.

author: Sam Houston
text: Texas, with her superior natural advantages, must become a point of attraction, and the policy of establishing with her the earliest relations of friendship and commerce will not escape the eye of statesmen.

author: Charles Dickens
text: Fan the sinking flame of hilarity with the wing of friendship; and pass the rosy wine.

author: William Hazlitt
text: Do not keep on with a mockery of friendship after the substance is gone - but part, while you can part friends. Bury the carcass of friendship: it is not worth embalming.

author: Dalai Lama
text: My aim is to create a happy society with genuine friendship. Friendship between Tibetan and Chinese peoples is very essential.

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
text: Love is flower like; Friendship is like a sheltering tree.

author: Thomas Jefferson
text: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
text: Friendship is a sheltering tree.

author: John O'Donohue
text: Most people are enduring a marginalized isolation. One of the great obstacles to modern friendships is the 'religion of rush.' People are rushing all the time through time. Friendship takes time.

author: David Storey
text: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.

author: Washington Irving
text: Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.

author: Marilyn Hacker
text: You are almost not free, if you are teaching a group of graduate students, to become friends with one of them. I don't mean anything erotically charged, just a friendship.

author: Zadie Smith
text: A lot of women, when they're young, feel they have very good friends, and find later on that friendship is complicated. It's easy to be friends when everyone's 18.

author: Russell Crowe
text: Meg Ryan is a beautiful and courageous woman. I grieve the loss of her companionship but I've not lost the friendship. We talk all the time and that was what our connection was about. She has a wonderful mind and we just like a chat.

author: Tim Finn
text: I think quite a lot of people have a friendship or a love that's gone like that and it never quite reconciles properly.

author: Blake Shelton
text: Stop using the word 'bromance.' Can we please kill that stupid term? We're just friends. It's called friendship!

author: Thomas Moore
text: Came but for friendship, and took away love.

author: William Hazlitt
text: Few things tend more to alienate friendship than a want of punctuality in our engagements. I have known the breach of a promise to dine or sup to break up more than one intimacy.

author: Sallust
text: To like and dislike the same things, this is what makes a solid friendship.

author: Carine Roitfeld
text: I mix talents and friendship, which is not very professional, but it's my way of thinking. So I love Azzedine Alaia, because I've known him for 30 years, and he's making my dresses most of the time.

author: Jean de la Bruyere
text: Time makes friendship stronger, but love weaker.

author: Jennifer Love Hewitt
text: I've always wanted to be a mom because I want to give a kid all of the magical gifts my mom gave to me, such as love and friendship. She and I had this incredible connection that was so unbelievable.

author: Mariella Frostrup
text: Sustaining true friendship is a lot more challenging than we give it credit for.

author: Jacqueline Leo
text: One look at an email can rob you of 15 minutes of focus. One call on your cell phone, one tweet, one instant message can destroy your schedule, forcing you to move meetings, or blow off really important things, like love, and friendship.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.

author: George MacDonald
text: If instead of a gem, or even a flower, we should cast the gift of a loving thought into the heart of a friend, that would be giving as the angels give.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
text: There is no friendship, no love, like that of the parent for the child.

author: Hank Haney
text: I know I was a great friend to Tiger Woods. But when you have a relationship that's involves business and friendship - and the business part comes to an end - things always get a little blurry.

author: Hector Hugh Munro
text: The sacrifices of friendship were beautiful in her eyes as long as she was not asked to make them.

author: Jane Austen
text: Business, you know, may bring you money, but friendship hardly ever does.

author: Charlotte Bronte
text: If we would build on a sure foundation in friendship, we must love friends for their sake rather than for our own.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: An excellent man; he has no enemies; and none of his friends like him.

author: Enrique Iglesias
text: My inspiration are the woman, friendship, and loneliness.

author: Saint Augustine
text: I want my friend to miss me as long as I miss him.

author: Tahar Ben Jelloun
text: I love life in spite of all that mars it. I love friendship, jokes and laughter.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
text: A friend is, as it were, a second self.

author: Doug Larson
text: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!

author: Zhang Ziyi
text: When two people first meet, they can only have a very ordinary kind of friendship. But when you begin to understand each other, when you get close to them, you discover that you're suddenly eager to know him or her even better.

author: George Santayana
text: Friendship is almost always the union of a part of one mind with the part of another; people are friends in spots.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
text: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.

author: Aimee Teegarden
text: I don't know if I've ever been in a clique. The older I've gotten, the more I've realized what a true friend really is. So my friendship circle has changed a bit.

author: Robert Staughton Lynd
text: Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
text: Rejoicing in our joy, not suffering over our suffering, makes someone a friend.

author: Mark Valley
text: I really wasn't even aware that Batman and Superman had this kind of grudging friendship.

author: Robert E. Lee
text: Never do a wrong thing to make a friend or to keep one.

author: Jill Scott
text: I've learned that friendship does not equate business, business does not equate friendship.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.

author: Andrew Sullivan
text: What gay culture is before it is anything else, before it is a culture of desire or a culture of subversion or a culture of pain, is a culture of friendship.

author: Cornelius Vanderbilt
text: There is no friendship in trade.

author: Mario Puzo
text: Friendship and money: oil and water.

author: Plautus
text: Friendship is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.

author: Toni Morrison
text: She is a friend of mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order. It's good, you know, when you got a woman who is a friend of your mind.

author: Simon Sinek
text: A friend is an emotional bond, just like friendship is a human experience.

author: Sarah Orne Jewett
text: Yes'm, old friends is always best, 'less you can catch a new one that's fit to make an old one out of.

author: King Solomon
text: As iron sharpens iron, so a friend sharpens a friend.

author: Hillary Clinton
text: America is stronger because of President Obama's leadership, and I'm better because of his friendship.

author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
text: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.

author: Hanya Yanagihara
text: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.

author: Saint Francis de Sales
text: A quarrel between friends, when made up, adds a new tie to friendship.

author: Woodrow Wilson
text: I have long enjoyed the friendship and companionship of Republicans because I am by instinct a teacher, and I would like to teach them something.

author: Jane Harrison
text: Marriage, for a woman at least, hampers the two things that made life to me glorious - friendship and learning.

author: Solange Knowles
text: When you think back in history about producers and artists or writers who've had good synergy, a lot of times they date, or they're married, or there's a friendship and a kinship.

author: Jonathan Edwards
text: Sincere friendship towards God, in all who believe him to be properly an intelligent, willing being, does most apparently, directly, and strongly incline to prayer; and it no less disposes the heart strongly to desire to have our infinitely glorious.

author: Trey Anastasio
text: Things have gone beyond my wildest expectations and dreams, and I feel like I've been given so many blessings in my life, between my friendship with the guys in the band, our wonderful audience, being able to play this music, and then my family.

author: Jena Malone
text: A lot of the powerful religious leaders, from Jesus to Buddha to Tibetan monks, they're really talking about the same things: love and acceptable, and the value of friendship, and respecting yourself so you can respect others.

author: Clifton Fadiman
text: One measure of friendship consists not in the number of things friends can discuss, but in the number of things they need no longer mention.

author: Julie Burchill
text: My second husband believed I had such a fickle attitude to friendship that each Friday he would update the list of my 'Top Ten' friends in the manner of a Top Of The Pops chart countdown.

author: John Webster
text: Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best.

author: Arthur Ashe
text: We must reach out our hand in friendship and dignity both to those who would befriend us and those who would be our enemy.

author: Lincoln Chafee
text: Israelis can be proud of the vibrant democracy that they have created, and I know that many Rhode Islanders share my deep appreciation for the close friendship between our two nations.

author: J. Donald Walters
text: Happiness is understanding that friendship is more precious than mere things, more precious than getting your own way, more precious than being in situations where true principles are not at stake.

author: William Penn
text: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.

author: Elbert Hubbard
text: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.

author: Susan Glaspell
text: As I grow older, I think friendship between women is a thing to cherish.

author: Alice Walker
text: I made my first white women friends in college; they loved me and were loyal to our friendship, but I understood, as they did, that they were white women and that whiteness mattered.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
text: But friendship is the breathing rose, with sweets in every fold.
